meanings.definition: Cause great and continual trouble or distress to.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors bedevil me every night with their loud music.
meanings.sent2: The constant rain bedevils the farmers trying to harvest their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel bedevils the gardener by stealing all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: Procrastination can bedevil even the most organized individuals.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure bedevils the old mansion, scaring away potential buyers.

meanings.sent1: The bullies at school bedevil the younger students every day.
meanings.sent2: The persistent telemarketers bedevil people with their constant calls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten loves to playfully bedevil the family dog.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories of the past bedevil her dreams at night.
meanings.sent5: The relentless paparazzi bedevil the privacy of the celebrities they follow.
